subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Andrea Fischbacher of Austria and Fabienne Suter of Switzerland shared a victory in a super-G that was shaped by varying wind and several crashes. It was the first World Cup victory for Fischbacher and Suter, who each finished in 1 minute 21.06 seconds on the Kandahar Banchetta course in Sestriere, Italy. The American Lindsey Vonn, Saturday’s downhill winner, finished 16th and dropped into a tie for the overall World Cup lead with Austrian Nicole Hosp, who placed 14th.Julia Mancuso was the top finisher for the United States, coming in eighth. She was faster than the winners through the first interval but lost time on the bottom as the course shifted to the other face of the Banchetta mountain and into the wind. Maria Riesch of Australia finished third, 0.24 back, to maintain her lead in the super-G standings.
